Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence that injecting ultraviolet light into the body would kill viruses like the novel coronavirus.
Understate: The claim understates the lack of scientific evidence to support alternative health treatments like ultraviolet blood irradiation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to back up the statement that ultraviolet radiation is administered into the body as a disinfectant to kill bacteria and viruses.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that ultraviolet radiation is an effective and established method for killing bacteria and viruses in the body.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation provided by health experts that there is no scientific evidence to support the claim and that it is inaccurate.
